intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. phrixocomoides, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive central disc and surrounding ray florets. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
